Reviews.Title: “Wow...tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Beenaround73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Aug '04 as part of my Olympic vacation. Never been to Europe before and my flight was set for in and out of Amsterdam cause it was the cheapest price around. Grabbed the train from the airport and it dropped me in the center of Amsterdam around 20 mins later. Arrived at Centraal and walked out and tried to orient myself as to where I was supposed to go. Luckily found a map out front and kind of just followed the crowd. A couple of minutes later found myself walking down the Damrak. Did my money exchange, walked around to see what was around, and then set out to find the hotel. Had a little bit of a hard time finding the numbers, but eventually got the hang of it...there was just so much signage to weed through. Finally found the hotel and went up the stairs to the reception area (that was a first for me, but is fairly typical in older buildings in Europe). The reception was basic and simple and old world decor. Lots of wood. My first impression was OK...maybe the rooms are a little better. So got my key and went to the room. Wow!! I don't know how they got a bed in there. As a matter of fact the door only opened half way before it hit the bed. There was a desk which I could use while sitting on the bed. The bed was worn down but not bad enough not to sleep in, which I was able to do for a grand total of probably 3 hours. There was a big window which I needed to have open because there was no AC, just a small desk fan. Of course, that let in all the noise from the surrounding pubs and restaurants. The neighbors were also rowdy. Made a mental note to bring along ear plugs next time. There was a small sink in the room and the bathroom was a common one shared by all on the floor. It was not certainly not what I expected but definitely an experience I'll remember. For the price, it had it's good and bad. Might even consider staying in the area, if not here, again knowing what I know now.

Reviews.Title: “One word - Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ccfc2011
Reviews.Content: I knew this hotel was going to be of a decent standard, as friends of mine had stayed here and enjoyed its many benefits. It's location is perfect I must say, a little noisy towards the end of the day but that's expected, and the windows do a good job of blocking out all the hustle and bussle. It's very close to all tourist attractions, cafes (weed kind), restaurants, shops, tour guides, etc. Everything is within walking distance, but if u are the kind who prefers to let others do the work for you, then I suggest the taxi bikes. You read it right it, a little carriage thing with a cover over it powered by sheer leg power :D It's great fun, and allows you to see Amsterdam from a different perspective; Amsterdam is incredibly busy on the streets so be alert all the time. Tourists stand out like a saw thumb! The owners were very nice and welcoming, with very attractive rates. I paid â‚¬100 for 2 nights for 2 people, you do the math! The room was perfect size for our intentions ;) The room was cleaned twice to a good standard, as well as clearing up our mess! The communal shower and toilet was sufficient, and served it's purpose. All in all, this hotel offers what I consider to be substantial benefits over many other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Angela2501
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel in august 2011. We were very surprised with the location of the hotel as it was 5 mins walk from the main train station and in the heart of the city! It was also close enough for us to visit some of the main attractions without any headaches. Room was clean and service was good. A nice place to do what you need to do without staying there too long.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean but definitely a budget hotel with small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: bshubert
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right in the heart of the action on the Damrak and a very short walk from the Red Light District. The neighborhood is loud but that is to be expected. One thing North Americans might find a little weird is that you leave your key at the hotel when you leave your room. The staff were helpful, and would tell you where to find the information if they didn't know. Another heads up, the stairs are incredibly steep, almost like climbing a ladder... 4 sets of them if you are staying on the top floor and you have to drag your bags all the way up.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Myra
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and it was an excellent location. Our room wasn't nothing special but it was big enough and the en-suite was also a good size. I think Room 10 is probably the best room in hotel as it has 3 windows looking out over the hustle and bustle of street where trams run up and down. Good for people watching with a carry out if you are on a budget. No noise disturbance as the people start going about their daily business. Very central to everything. Staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great for tokers”
Reviews.Author: Aced_up
Reviews.Content: Hotel is situated right in the hustle and bustle. Food and entertainment all around! I was at the SIbos event during the week and was staying at a premium hotel before switching to accommodate my own pocket. And you do pay for what you get! I shouldve booked earlier! Now, if you have large bags you may have to negotiate some crazy stairs which are in the back of the hotel. Attendants are nice and friendly. In my view, this is a great hotel if you are one of the weed smokers or out to get mildly wrecked. Definately not for the couples that want a peaceful sleep! The street in the back will keep you up or interfere with your sleep with the drunken bafoons shouting. Windows are not great. The first thing I noticed is the pungent smell of weed, eearrgh You may be woken up by the stoned giggling residents in the next room or rooms above... The stink of smoke is horrible. The smoke alarm is covered with plastic. Given people can smoke whatever they like in their rooms the fire hazard is greatly increased. hmmm, safe. There appears to be a mouse problem or at least there was...Mouse poison may be found in the wardrobe area. You may experience a sewage smell after rainfall, I believe this is normal. Just run the shower for 5 mins and the smell disappears. Something to do with the stangnant drainage water. The shower doesnt look upto much but is quite ok. Bed is really soft, probably broken. Very uncomfortable. Hoovers get turned on at 8.30am!!! All in all, this place is fine if you are drunk or too stoned to care. If you are in Amsterdam to party and/or smoke.. then this will be suitable for you.

Reviews.Title: “the budget solution”
Reviews.Author: ketchup1981
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in April due to the volcano ash cloud which delayed all the flights in that period. The hotel we had stayed in until that time tripled the prices over night as a result of the high demand for rooms in that period of time, with everyone stuck on the ground for what seemed then an indefinite period. We searched for a cheaper alternative, for one more night, as we were short on cash, having in mind that the following morning we had to take the bus back home, which was an extra cost. We went to Damrak Street, from hotel to hotel asking for the price for one room, and we found the cheapest room here, EUR60 for a shared facilities room (the hotel had rooms with private bathrooms too, but they were more expensive). We didnâ€™t have breakfast, as we were leaving very early in the morning. The conditions were very basic, and the furniture rather old, but the room was clean enough and so were the shared toilet and shower. There was rat trap in the room, but fortunately it was empty :). However, I havenâ€™t seen a more expensive room, with private bathroom, it is possible that it looks better than the one we stayed in, I donâ€™t know. The stairs were narrow and pretty hard to climb, especially with luggage. There is no elevator. The staff was polite and helpful. Overall we put aside the drawbacks of this hotel bearing in mind the fact that it was the cheapest we could find in a time when all hotels increased their rates. For the moment, it was the solution to our problem. I would recommend this hotel for someone constrained by the budget; it is somehow an alternative to a hostel. It is OK if you just want to have roof above your head.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Thomas-gr
Reviews.Content: Quite good choice but it coulb be better. Nevertheless, best among the hotels we found in that part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “The place we will always be happy to remember”
Reviews.Author: dfundfun
Reviews.Content: very simple clean nice hotel perfect location, perfect service and very clean .

Reviews.Title: “dirty and ripped off, small + dangerous or what nearly hits you, if yur not quick + could make you fall down the stairs!”
Reviews.Author: pothead1pothead2
Reviews.Content: "STAY AWAY" me and my boyfriend stayed in hotel van gelder from 4th - 7th july 2009 3 NIGHTS AND 4 DAYS, we was in room 17 which is on the very top floor and the stairs get very narrow at the top and the steps arent as wide so you can only walk up the stairs on your tip toes or the side of your feet if you know what i mean, but then at the top of the stairs theres a door what opens out onto the stairs so you have to be quick if you dont want the door to hit you and send you flying down stasirs. The shower is that small you have to get out to put on shower creme or keep turning the shower off, not good this is verry frustrating. The bed was to singles with a double matress on the top but then with 2 single quilts....? The lighting was verry dark Says theres cabe t.v but doesn't say its NOT FREE. Looked at this hotel when i got back home and its 75 euros per night for double room we got charged 80 (but theres no discount for online booking)....? so they RIPPED US OFF !!!!!!!! The room was swealtering HOT, there was a window but no good when its 32 degrees ans 27 degrees etc.. The rooms DID NOT HAVE HOUSEKEEPING the whole time we was there.... NOT GOOD... very UNHYGENIC.! And last but not least we had to keep asking for clean towels,,,,,,,, DISCUSTING......... DONT STAY

Reviews.Title: “quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: beniblanc0
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel four times in last fifteen years basic but great value for money would definately stay again location great staff friendly and shower in the room looking forward to next visit

Reviews.Title: “Nice place for the price”
Reviews.Author: kerrilp
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Van Gelder for 2 nights 1 1/2 years ago. Since Amsterdam has gotten quite expensive over the past few years, I thought the price (at that time 75euro) was a good deal because it included a bath whereas other similarly priced properties did not. Although stairs are steep (yes, you get a workout), I found the accomodations satisfactory. I tried to pay with a credit card, and for some reason the 'machine wasn't working', which I found a bit ridiculous. So I had to pay cash. The room was clean as well as the small bath. The walls are paper thin - I don't think they are real walls! And someone tried to come into our room. I think it was a very drunk/stoned person who got confused. The mattresses were also very weird kind of springy, but comfortable enough. Also this review may sound negative, I did enjoy my stay there due to the cleanliness and the location. I'm actually staying there again in Oct 2008, so I would recommend staying if you are seeking a budget hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Rude”
Reviews.Author: cm94pph
Reviews.Content: My wife and i failed to get a decent sleep in this place because off the cleaners starting to hoover from 8am. On top of this the lady whom is always there during breakfast was incredibly rude and bad mannered. We presented ourselves for breakfast at reception and were told in a very impolite way (like we were naughty school children) "..Sit here..." Normally one would expect somthing like. Good morning or welcome. Please sit here. But know she directs you like she is some barrack room corpral. We had a further concern here. A black gentleman came down for breakfast and said good morning. She completely ignored him and when he said hello again. She snapped back "I said morning..." Well this was a lie because my wife and i both heard nothing. She does seem rascist towards blacks and ive noticed how she treats them differently. Its a real shame that this hotel seems to have gone down hill. It was nice last year, But i'm afraid we will not stay again and certainly not put up with this womans bad manners and the way she tries to force you to sit at a table with Loud heckling Spaniards. Or latterly A fat Italina slurping his tea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant value for money”
Reviews.Author: d4nn12004
Reviews.Content: me and my husband spent 3 nights here without booking in advance. Excellant value for money as other hotels in this area are sooooo expensive. 2 minutes walk from Red light, located in the street directly behind the hotel is the main shopping street miles long. very clean friendly staff and got your own bathroom showers are excellant.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Osito_Chiquito
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights without booking in advance. Clean room + own bathroom, comfortable bedding. Various front desk staff friendly + accommodating. Location excellent, 1 min. walk from Centraal Station and 1.5 blocks away from red light district. Main shopping area (very very long street, a few kilometres!) starts on street behind the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PeteBear
Reviews.Content: Hi There, I have now been staying in this hotel whilst on business for 3 months. It is very reasonably priced. Clean. Comfortable and very near train station and red light district. Much better value for money than the other hotels in its location. very funney crazy old man doing the door a couple of nights a week during midweek. Very amusing. Critisism: Could do with having a hot breakfast rather than the continetal breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel was scarry looking but once inside the accommodation was clean, tidy and very good value for money.

HotelInfo.Name: Van Gelder Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Damrak 34, Amsterdam 1012 LK , The Netherlands
